intro: Mediocalcar rigidulum, commonly known as the rigid sandwort, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. This plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in parts of southern Africa and the Mediterranean. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
